title: 114_s1219
content: SECTION 1. RELIABILITY AND DISTRIBUTED RESOURCES. Section 111(d) of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 is amended to include consideration of safe and reliable interconnection of distributed resources, with definitions for ancillary services and distributed resources. The amendment to Section 111(d) of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 includes definitions for ancillary services and distributed resources, requiring State regulatory authorities to establish proceedings to ensure safe, reliable, and efficient grid interconnection for distributed resources. SEC. 2. NET METERING EFFECTS. Section 111(d) of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 is amended to require State regulatory authorities to examine the effects of net metering and customer-owned distributed generation on resource planning of electric utilities. This includes assessing impacts on resource utilization, fuel diversity, grid security, and grid cost allocation. State regulatory authorities must assess the financial health and investment attractiveness of entities providing distribution services in relation to net metering and customer-owned distributed generation. They should also establish proceedings to determine the fairness of electricity rates for net metering services. SEC. 3. COMPLIANCE. Time Limitations for State Regulatory Authorities and Electric Utilities to consider and set hearings for standards established by section 111(d) of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978. State regulatory authorities and nonregulated electric utilities must complete consideration and make determinations regarding standards set by section 111(d) of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978. Failure to comply may result in consequences outlined in section 112(c). The reference in this subsection to the date of enactment of this Act is considered to be the date of enactment of those paragraphs.
